I saw it. Just let me know when we start up again so I know when to get on. That being said, time for some in-character stuff:

The following is an announcement from the Imperial Leader.

It came to my attention that the Phoenix Corporation is using a tragic event to deface the name of Kerbal Imperial Astronautics. The Phoenix Corporation claims that a recent attack on a Caldari Navy research instillation was carried out by members of the Imperial Navy.

That is far from the truth. Reliable sources indicate that the attack was carried out by a pirate force of unknown origin. This pirate force then escaped into Imperial Space where they were caught and found guilty of piracy and the slaughter of over one hundred scientists and support staff. In accordance with Imperial laws, the pirates were sentenced to life imprisonment and the prototype they had stolen was destroyed.

In light of this tragic event, the Imperial Navy will be increasing its firepower and presence in Imperial Space to prevent such a tragedy from happening in Imperial Space.

A memorial in honor of the fallen scientists and support staff will be gifted to the Phoenix Corporation to erect at the spot of the horrible massacre. My sincere condolences go out to the families and friends of those who tragically lost their lives.

The above was an announcement from the Imperial Leader

(out of character)

I would have done this in a video but I'm a little under the weather at the moment. :/

Announcment by WMC

Material prices for consumable goods will rise due to the latest attack of Pirates. As a reaction to maintain stability across the Kerbol SOI and its inhabitants all Kerbals are adviced to reduce their needs.

As long as the WMC is not supported and protected, we can not reduce prices again as we must rack up defenses to provide a stable and reliable support of needed goods.

Therefore the weapon and ship materials will be produced with higher workforce and a cost reduce for protectors by 15%.

All workers of WMC that have a A4998- Code are held to start working in the defense industry building to rack up the workforce in that sector.

The changes will follow in Numbers:

Consumable goods: +20% Costs

Weaponry and Defense amterial: -15%(For protectors)

Minerals: +-0%

!Thank you for your attention!

A last presonal statement of the Corps. president:"We do not tolerate piracy, we feel for the families that lost their loved ones in the recent attack and will therfore have an hour of silence tomorrow."

End of Announcement

ANNOUNCEMENT FROM THE KSPOLICE

The KSPolice would like to announce that it will be providing full support to any and all trade corporations in order to keep trade as safe as possible and to protect the lives of the traders involved.

All trade convoys will be receiving a support squad of 2 fighters each initially.

in 3 months time each can expect a frigate and 3 months later will receive a full carrier instead of the fighters and a cruiser instead of a frigate.

In one years time, the goal is that every convoy can have a carrier and battleship defending it as well as the frigates and cruses used stationed at necessary check points along trade routs.

However, this process will increase all taxes to citizens by 2% in order to push the production of ships to meet this goal. This should, in the end, preserve the trade routes and keep the economy growing and recovering in these hard times.

Hopefully The KSPolice will be able to supply all the protection needed and the cost of goods going up won't be necessary.

Thanks for you time citizens

Regards

The KSPolice

The following is an announcement from the Imperial Minister of Defense

Kerbal Imperial Astronautics would like to remind all civilian ships entering Imperial Space that they are in one of the safest zones in the solar system. In order to keep up this high standard and to protect your ships, the Imperial Navy will be enforcing zone passport laws in accordance to Kerbal regulations. Please broadcast your assigned passport codes at Imperial frequency I7 as soon as you are hailed by Imperial vessels. If you do not have a passport code contact your local Imperial office or an office of another corporation.

I can assure you that Imperial Space is and will continue to be the safest place for civilian ships of all caliber.

Thank you for your continued cooperation

MESSAGE BEGINS:

Bill's Independent Research Congregations would like to inform all civilians that until further notice no civilian ships will be tolerated in B.I.R.C Space. We are leaving behind our nomadic background and taking settlement in the Outer Rim of this system. All incoming ships shall be stopped at our borders and be submitted to stringent border and contraband checks as detailed in Paragraph 13 Section 4 of B.I.R.C Interstellar Trade Agreements. Any Civilian vessel found to be violating this directive will be brought in for questioning and/or detainment until further notice. All non B.I.R.C Civilian ships have a period of 1 week to withdraw from our space or measures will be taken to ensure the safety and survival of our Corporation. Allied military vessels should transmit their designated authorisation codes, BEFORE entering B.I.R.C Territory.

We would like to thank all of you for your co-operation.

MESSAGE ENDS:
